TopicTitle: [11/26/15 Update] Say Hello to the Light-Green Group!

Articles.Content:
Small thing, can you put a space between "members with X bars" and the first name, and make that text bold and italics? And possibly centered? I would say it's ready to use after that point.

So I will add the descriptions for those who don't have them? And after I do, it'll recognize that and use it next time I run it?

There's supposed to be a space there, but it doesn't seem to be adding it. I figure you can fix those couple lines yourself (or just copy and paste the users for each section). But I'll set it up so you can change that text in the config and it'll put it in automatically.

For users without descriptions you just add their name and description to the descriptions file and it will handle it automatically in the future. You don't even have to put them in the file in any specific order, you just have to make sure the name is correct. For example:


magico13. Magico13 has a description 
Endersmens. [COLOR="#123456"] He's running this show!

For username colors to work (since usernames must be precise and have a period after them) I made it so if the description starts with a color, that color gets applied to the username. So you can't color the first word of a description unfortunately, but that won't come up often. Unfortunately, I can't figure out how to color urls. I'm still looking into it.

Edit: Does this color work? NathanKell. Creator of a variety of wonderful mods, including Deadly Reentry and Real Solar System, as well as a distinguished "Modder-ator."

yes! Ok, colors will work with links now

Edit2. Cpt. Kipard has a period in his name... that makes it unable to find his description. Looks like I need to switch to a different thing than a period in the description file. Anyone know off hand what things are forbidden in the usernames? Umm, maybe I'll just go with a tab, since that's probably the least used?

Final edit for the night: Here is the download: https://www.dropbox.com/s/o10npdemy67apa9/LightGreenUpdater.zip?dl=0

I've licensed it as MIT since everything on the forums needs a license.

The LGU_settings.txt file must stay in the same folder as the .exe (which is a .net application targeting .NET 3.5 like KSP). Inside that file you can change a few things:

  • searchURL: The URL to use when making the search. [pageNUMBER] gets replaced automatically with what page of the search it should be on (since we can only view 30 at a time)
  • DescriptionFile: Points to where the descriptions are held
  • OutputFile: Where you want the final thing to output
  • NewMemberTxt: What the description for members who aren't in the description list should be
  • NameSeparator: When it outputs, it uses Username"separator" Description. By default, it's period (magico13. Desc). Change it to something else (like : ) to get (magico13: desc)
  • Bars6 through Bars1: The text to display between regions with different bar levels

The descriptions file just requires one username - description pair per line with the following format

USERNAME[tab]DESCRIPTION

(ie, magico13\t Description)

It has a few special tricks. Setting the start of the description to (or any other colors) will color the username with that color. You should also enter these as if you were typing them into the forum post (so use the SIZE= and [i /i] tags [purposefully trying to avoid triggering them, you get the idea]). Don't enter colors as anything except the hex value. I stupidly put a fixed size in there and forgot to change that (so you can't use COLOR=RED for instance). If the user's description is just "Ignore" (w/o quotes) then they'll be ignored. Currently that's just used for the SQUAD users.

I think that basically sums it all up!


  1. [Members with Six Light-Green Bars (1500+ Points): These are the most-Repped, most-beloved, and best personalities on the entire Forum.]
  2. 5thHorseman. 5th Horseman has a good YouTube series going, and is very insightful with with his posts. One time, he made an asteroid into a plane!
  3. Majorjim. This "Waterman" builds really great craft, and lots of them. He also puts out many high-quality, insightful posts. He's a great person to have around the Spacecraft Exchange.
  4. UpsilonAerospace. Mastermind behind this thread, and keeper of this thread until recently! Give this man some rep!
  5. Rune. Another builder of a variety of lovely craft, another excellent poster, and a great help to the new builders of the Spacecraft Exchange.
  6. RoverDude. He's a "Cat Herder" and a notable and widely respected modder. Creator of the "Umbra Space Industries" series. His mods are widely believed to be among the coolest additions to the game.
  7. zekes. "First Sea Lorde," Founder of Zokesia Skunkworks, and clever person overall. His shuttle still impresses me a lot.
  8. NathanKell. Creator of a variety of wonderful mods, including Deadly Reentry and Real Solar System, as well as a distinguished "Modder-ator."
  9. ObsessedWithKSP. Clever poster, good suggest-er and a smart person in general. He's informally in charge of the ever-helpful Squadcast reviews as well.
  10. sarbian. Mod maker, intelligent poster, "Purveyor of the Nyan Cat," and nice person as a whole. Sarbian is especially helpful with teaching new modders the tips of the trade.
  11. GregroxMun. The official conductor of the Hype Train, GregroxMun is a streamer, an artistic, creative type, and an all-around good guy.
  12. Brotoro. Goes on a variety of grand and fun KSP adventures in the Jool system and more recently on Duna. He is not my neighbor, though. Where did you get that idea?
  13. GusTurbo. He's a Craft Design Craftsman who creates a variety of quality spacecraft! He's never afraid to share his knowledge, state his opinions, or partake in competitions on the Forum.
  14. ferram4. Created Ferram Aerospace Research, or FAR, along with other nice mods. He makes things fly properly in KSP. (And he's continuing to do so, even after the release of 1.0!)
  15. Yukon0009. Formerly Majorjim's Apprentice, this great builder is now a self-proclaimed Weavy Geapons Huy, and a builder of great historic rocket replicas and other neat little craft.
  16. Claw. "Claw-erator" who has created plugins and moderated the Forums for a while now. His bugfixes are very much appreciated by the community... Thanks TxeKnab!
  17. Whackjob. Wait, you can make rockets that big?! Whackjob is nice, even if he's a... little... nutty. Plus, he was the first member of the Light-Green Group! So that counts for something.
  18. Starwhip. Everyone's favorite Red Dragon, and a very helpful Forum-goer. He's artistic and intelligent and very kind.
  19. Vanamonde. A great and long-lasting moderator. Apparently, his posts come from inside my house. Who knew?
  20. r4pt0r. Formerly "Proudly 99% Stock," and an Amateur Ancient Historian, r4pt0r is a intelligent poster and an honest guy. (He likes my plugin songs, too.)
  21. Tw1. He builds some neat craft, creates creative things in Fan Works, and an all-around nice guy. Also, he's a self-proclaimed "Space Nutter."
  22. lajoswinkler. Lajoswinkler is a prolific and helpful poster, mostly in the Other Forums. He's a 'Kapsulni kommunikator,' to use the... um... Russian, maybe?
    [Members with Five Light-Green Bars (1300-1499 Points): These people are incredibly well-known, and only one step away from being Internet famous!]
  23. Kuzzter. A "Powerpointillist" with a pretty wonderful graphic novel series called "Duna, Ore Bust!" that showcases his ongoing mission to the Red Planet!
  24. Mad Rocket Scientist. Well, the name pretty much says it all. Mad Rocket Scientist creates some pretty cool KSP craft of all types.
  25. NecroBones. Another modder, who also creates video tutorials and goes on impressive missions... and is also a great and honest poster. He does pretty much everything.
  26. NovaSilisko. "Spherical Scientist" and former dev. His new game, "Science of the Spheres," looks really cool. Oh, and he does music too!
  27. Giggleplex777. A great builder of small craft, and the head of the famous "Pico Space Program!" Giggleplex is also simply an all-around nice Forum-goer.
  28. BahamutoD. Modder and creator of BD Armory, among other lovely and very pretty mods. He's also a pretty serious metal guitarist, and his epic KSP theme is definitely something to look into.
  29. Nertea. Well-known for his gorgeous mods, including Near Future Technologies and Stockalike Station Parts.
  30. KasperVld. The new Lead Moderator! Kasper's insights and comments make him well deserving of his position.
  31. DMagic. Yet another awesome mod creator. DMagic has created mods such as ScanSat and DMagic Orbital Science.
  32. Geschosskopf. Creator of several very nice tutorials. You wouldn't believe how many times I tried to spell his name before I got it right.
  33. Felsmak. Creates zany and wonderful craft and zany and wonderful ideas. His creativity is nearly infinite, and his voice could buy Russia. (Great Naked Space Man reference!)
  34. Beale. Mod-maker extraordinaire, with a very, very creepy avatar. Like, seriously. It's bread... but... I'll stop now. You're welcome.
    [Members with Four Light-Green Bars (1100-1299 Points): These people are rising in the ranks and are becoming very well known throughout the Forums and beyond!]
  35. Xacktar. Hilarious guy with a YouTube channel. All hail Xacktar, he's really cool! (Seriously, though. Valentina the Rocket Lady is great.)
  36. stupid_chris. A great former moderator who also developed RealChute parachute systems. That penguin, though... it vibrates! And vibrates, and vibrates...
  37. RocketPilot573. Builds a variety of really awesome craft, and has a number of wonderful ideas.
  38. Alshain. An honest and kind poster who does his best to solve problems and help others across the Forum. According to his life's persistent file, he's a smartS.
  39. Starwaster. A frequent poster and a notable modder, Starwaster is the Defender of the Sandbox.
  40. cantab. A knowledgeable, clever poster with no shortage of good ideas, cantab tries to help out or offer his opinion wherever possible.
  41. Avera9eJoe. From Twitch streaming to YouTubing to modding to music, Avera9eJoe is simply 100% awesome.
  42. nightingale. Nightingale's superior work creating mods has earned this Forum-goer a lot of Reputation in a very short time. Congrants, nightingale!
  43. Cupcake.... One of the best VTOL builders in KSP, Cupcake...'s builds are always quite nice (and very impressive)... perhaps even more so in 1.0!
  44. pandoras kitten. No Description Yet!
  45. Streetwind. A nice person and prolific poster in the "Other Forums." He "Talks to boosters," too, but I'm afraid that can't be helped.
  46. sgt_flyer. A clever builder of a variety of different, unconventional designs. I personally love his little turbofan engine... it's such a cool idea!
    [Members with Three Light-Green Bars (900-1099 Points): These people are halfway through the Light-Green Group, and destined for greatness!]
  47. Azimech. If you haven't seen his turboprop engines, do so. Like, right now. They're really cool. (He's working on new ones, too, now that 1.0 has dropped...)
  48. GoSlash27. An intelligent and rather prolific poster, and a "Sliderule Jockey." GoSlash is knowledgeable with both KSP and real-world spaceflight.
  49. parameciumkid. Creator of some very neat craft, great poster, and "Kerbal Pamperer." He has some great, well-thought-out ideas.
  50. katateochi. Craft builder, YouTuber, co-host of KerbalX, and "Bewildered Kerbal." Everything that katateochi does is quite high-quality and very nice.
  51. TriggerAu. Creator of Kerbal Alarm Clock, one of the most useful and frustration-preventing mods in KSP (in my opinion, at least).
  52. Robotengineer. This "Kerbal Space Pundit" is frequently snarky, even more frequently hilarious, and a rising star on the KSP forums.
  53. astropapi1. Knowledgeable, nice, and very informative, astropapi usually frequents the Other Forums. He's an Aerospace Engineer-to-be, and I'm sure he'll make a great one.
  54. inigma. This Forum-goer's spacecraft builds are quite nice. (You might have seen his shuttle; he's quite well-known for it. It's good.)
  55. Tiberion. Creator of space shuttle mods, as well as other nice game add-ons. Tiberion's also a long-time Forumgoer and former Moderator.
  56. Wanderfound. A great builder of SSTO craft, and a big fan of Mk2 parts. Wanderfound's spaceplane emporium features some really nice stuff.
  57. Kasuha. Incredibly knowledgeable, especially with KSP. I personally benefited from his Fuel Flow Rules. He hasn't posted in a while though.
  58. sumghai. "Sumdumerator" (moderator), creator of numerous mods, and a helpful Forum-goer to new modders.
  59. SkyRender. A long-time Forum-goer who is well-known for his clever and insightful posts. "Not for resale."
  60. eorin. A "Blackbird-addicted" Forumgoer who created Sparrowhawk Aeronautics, and a load of great craft to boot!
    [Members with Two Light-Green Bars (700-899 Points): These people have been posting for a while, and are beginning to get some serious attention!]
  61. Cpt. Kipard. "Ambient occlusion baker," "Resident Curmudgeon," realistic-minded and excellent poster, and creator of several mods.
  62. Roflcopterkklol. This "Mad Scientist" is best known for his large, complex, and cool-looking aircraft... even if some of them were slightly broken by 1.0.
  63. rbray89. Creator of several notable mods, including Active Texture Management and EVE (Environmental Visual Enhancement).
  64. RevanCorana. Creator of a number of distinctive and fun KSP craft of all types. "Strut Tamer." (I really should learn to tame my struts too.)
  65. Porkjet. Creator of Spaceplane Plus, a mod that was recently integrated into the official game! Porkjet continues being closely affiliated with SQUAD.
  66. KerrMÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¼. No Description Yet!
  67. worir4. Fabulous poster, owner of the most distinguished mustached-Kerbal avatar on the Forums, and "Nose Cone." (A lot of people seemed to like this description the last time around, for some reason.)
  68. Levelord. Creator of several lovely craft, and a good poster. I would say more, but I'm stuck staring at that animated .gif avatar.
  69. pizzaoverhead. Another wonderful modder, pizzaoverhead creates some small but significant additions to the game that make it feel more realistic.
  70. vexx32. Moderator of the Support and Development subforum, and incredibly helpful community member. He watches you at night.
  71. Endersmens. (me!)"Rumored to stalk you at night, teleport, and eat your soul, Endersmens is actually a friendly Forum-goer who is quite helpful across the board. At least, that's what I'm supposed to say........... don't eat me" - UpsilonAerospace, 2015. RIP.
  72. soulreaver1981. Creator of a variety of wonderful craft, and head of Reapers Dutch Designs. His spaceplanes are neat!
  73. Foxster. No Description Yet!
  74. blackrack. Creator of a gorgeous atmospheric scattering mod ("Scatterer"), blackrack has quickly accumulated enough +Rep to join the Group.
  75. Nik_601. Usually seen creating tremendously cool things in the Spacecraft Exchange, such as working helicopters.
  76. xEvilReeperx. EvilReeper's stock clamshell fairings propelled him to the Group, thanks to their high desirability after 1.0's release.
  77. Mareczex333. Mareczex is an incredibly good spaceplane builder (especially with replicas of historic aircraft), and a prominent YouTuber as well!
  78. Proot. I... AM... PROOT! (Sorry, had to get that out of my system.) Proot is the creator of the wonderful Renaissance Arts compilation, a plugin that makes the game look wonderful.
  79. Columbia. No Description Yet!
  80. John FX. Another intelligent poster. I personally enjoyed his graphs on engine performance, though many of his other posts are quite high-quality as well.
  81. andrew123. Creator of some wonderful craft, including a very nice boat and World War II plane replicas. "Bane of the Desert Fox."
  82. KospY. Creator of KAS (Kerbal Attachment System), a mod that allows things to be attached together wherever and whenever you want!
  83. Frozen_Heart. No Description Yet!
  84. Frank_G. Another awesome craft-builder and great poster, Frank_G is a "Kerbol System Explorer" and a good graphic designer!
  85. Pecan. Another wonderful poster, and the creator of some lovely tutorials. Pecan is, according to his profile picture, "Only slightly nuts."
  86. klgraham1013. klgraham's snarky but very valid opinions have earned him some serious Reputation, especially as 1.0 approached.
  87. Nikola7007. Another rather awesome poster with a good point of view. Also, he's quite proud of his lack of a profile picture...
  88. Kerdinand. The "King of Random" and a wonderful builder, Kerdinand has created a variety of truly unique and quite good-looking craft!
  89. tater. A great poster in all parts of the Forum, tater is both prolific and wise. He's a newer member of the Forum but already has over 1,700 posts!
  90. Mesklin. A builder of a variety of quality craft over at the Spacecraft Exchange. Recently, Mesklin went to Eve in 1.0, earning the respect of the Forum in the process...
  91. technicalfool. This moderator does a great job promoting rational discussion, and his profile pic is also quite neat.
  92. HarvesteR. KSP Developer who has been fundamental in making the game what it is today. Thanks, HarvesteR!
  93. blizzy78. Creator of a great number of helpful add-ons and plugins for KSP, most notably Toolbar! He has been rather inactive lately though.
  94. magico13. Creator of Kerbal Construction Time and other fantastic plugins, magico13 is a notable modder and a friendly community member.
  95. DuoDex. No Description Yet!
  96. Niemand303. This "Tovarisch Moderator" is a creator of several mods, including a great one that depicts the Soyuz spacecraft in-game.
  97. RogueMason. Creator of a great variety of spacecraft and nice craft, RogueMason is also well-known for his great short stories.
  98. landfish2. No Description Yet!
  99. gGATORr. Another craft-builder who has created a number of quite impressive aircraft. He is, apparently, "The Admiral."
  100. Redshift OTF. Builder of some wonderful sci-fi ships, including the Death Star and a Skylon SSTO concept!
    [Members with One Light-Green Bar (500-699 Points): These are the newest members of the Light-Green Group. Let's give them a warm welcome!]
  101. Majiir. Developed the Kethane mod, an excellent and very frequently used mod that introduced the equivalent of Ore into the game before it was popular.
  102. Renegrade. "Sir Wingsalot" makes loads of great posts across the Forum. He's frequently got a point.
  103. Randazzo. No Description Yet!
  104. Darth Lazarus. Another great craft designer, Darth Lazarus creates beautiful replicas of spacecraft, including the SLS!
  105. Rowsdower. Formerly the Kommunity Manager, Rowsdower remains a beloved member of the Forums. His leadership and help will not be forgotten...
  106. razark. A noted poster and kind helper across the entirety of the Forum, razark is also the newest member of the Light-Green Group! Welcome!
  107. clown_baby. No Description Yet!
  108. keptin. Creator of Kerbal Aircraft Expansion, or KAX, and maker of an incredible tutorial on aircraft design.
  109. Norpo. This "Chaotic Good" creates posts that are witty, insightful, and uses in-game jokes that only players would understand, earning him some serious reputation.
  110. hellblazer. No Description Yet!
  111. Jon144. No Description Yet!
  112. Jolly_Roger. No Description Yet!
  113. FlowerChild. Creator of the fantastic plugin 'Better than Starting Manned,' FlowerChild has improved many a Career-mode gameplay experience.
  114. Exothermos. Yet another wonderful spacecraft designer. You should check out his shuttle too, along with his gorgeous "Valkyrie" replica.
  115. frizzank. Creator of a variety of very nice mods, including the well-known FASA and Nova Punch Parts Pack.
  116. MOARdV. Wait, wasn't it supposed to be 'boosters?' ...Oh, okay. MOARdV maintains the really neat mod RasterPropMonitor, along with other great projects.
  117. alexustas. This modder is rapidly rising the Reputation ranks (he just joined this March), thanks to some very promising new mods such as ALCOR and Exploration Rover System.
  118. Camacha. A very funny and frequently quite intelligent poster in the Other Forums, Camacha is well-deserving of being in the Group.
  119. Jouni. A very knowledgeable and helpful poster, Jouni also has created some very nice-lookin' and practical craft.
  120. Capt'n Skunky. Wonderful guy who left last year and came back recently (yay!). It's always nice to see him around again...
  121. tg626. No Description Yet!
  122. KHTRE. No Description Yet!
  123. Padishar. No Description Yet!
  124. Ippo. Ippo is a frequent and often-helpful or funny poster, known as "NetKan's Tsar." His profile picture is... um... Pikasponge? Bobachu? ...interesting.
  125. Kerbart. This grumpy-yet-lovable Forum-goer is never afraid to speak up loudly about matters he's passionate about, as well as creating some humorous posts.

  128. eddiew. No Description Yet!

  130. K^2. No Description Yet!

White Bar Members

  1. Red Iron Crown. Red Iron Crown is very knowledgeable and likable. Always enlivening conversations, he is fair and well-deserving of the #1 spot. He recently also became a "Common Demoderator," congrats!
  2. regex. This honest and refreshing personality is never afraid to speak his mind, especially about Squad. He's a "Realistic Spacehippie."
  3. sal_vager. Fair and exalted moderator. Sal_vager recently passed the 10,000-post mark, the highest post count of any member of the KSP forums by far!
  4. Overfloater. Creator of gigantic stock SSTOs, "Rocket Bottleer," and all-around good guy. His profile pic is quite mesmerizing.
  5. Zucal. Zucal just joined this March! His meteoric rise to fame was a result of his astoundingly good craft and very clever ideas.
  6. KerrMu. An extraordinarily clever builder, and the person with the highest Reputation-to-post-count ratio in the Light-Green Group. It's absurd, really.
  7. FrozenHeart. This "White Walker" is a great poster, but more importantly, she came up with the name before the movie came out.
  8. Spartwo. An ardent "militarist," Spartwo's military-oriented craft are great for space battles and aesthetically pleasing, too!
  9. Captain Sierra. Another wonderful poster and helpful member of the community, Captain Sierra is also noted for his neat designs.

Wat.

Someone wrote...an actual program...to count the amount of silly green internet points people on a space game forum have?

Well.

Yes, and you and me and some other folks sent him some silly green internet points to thank him. Now if someone reps our posts because of our clever observations, he'll have to modify the program to account for this recursion...which will no doubt net magico13 even more rep...inspiring additional witty comments...driving the program to nth order complexity and destroying the Forum as we know it. Oh well, it's been a good ride.

Wat.

Someone wrote...an actual program...to count the amount of silly green internet points people on a space game forum have?

Well.

It's more that I wrote a translator. The thing that counts the silly green points is the forum software itself, which not only counts them but was also the creator of these specific green points. All I do is translate the ordered list of members it provides, into an ordered list in a different form. Besides, I like little projects like this that only take a few hours to implement

Now, it would get far more complex if I actually tried to count how much rep everyone has, since the forum doesn't tell me that in the search results. I'd have to extract that out of the user's profile page. Thankfully I am told the link to that page, so it wouldn't be too hard, but then it's less of a translation Doing it for everyone on the forum would take hours, and I'd probably be told not to do that anymore by the Squad employees

Yes, and you and me and some other folks sent him some silly green internet points to thank him. Now if someone reps our posts because of our clever observations, he'll have to modify the program to account for this recursion...which will no doubt net magico13 even more rep...inspiring additional witty comments...driving the program to nth order complexity and destroying the Forum as we know it. Oh well, it's been a good ride.

Thankfully the program always grabs the latest data, so it shouldn't create a snowball effect that destroys the forums (and the world! muahahahaha!) It'll just be a little out of date until it gets run again.

But keeping a running list of every user's reputation, including all transactions (who sends rep to who, and when)... I could make that happen... I could become the REPUTATION OVERLORD! MUAHAHAHAHAHA! INFINITE TINY GREEN FAKE INTERNET POWAH! (why do we not have a laughing kerbal icon? Normal or evil, both variants would be nice)

Wat.

Someone wrote...an actual program...to count the amount of silly green internet points people on a space game forum have?

Well.

That's about how felt. Let's all rep magico13 as fast as we can to throw off his calculations! <-------JOKEJOKEJOKE!

Hmm never thought about doing some calculations to find out how long it will take you to get a certain amount of rep..... Im going to see how my pace is at. I got 2 more years of forum roaming left until....

Edited September 1, 2015 by ghostbuzzer7

Hmm never thought about doing some calculations to find out how long it will take you to get a certain amount of rep.....

Oh no, you're giving me ideas. Don't do that! I could write something that will you give an estimate of how long until you get to a certain rep level. But that might be a little too excessive Estimating yourself is ok, writing a program to make arranging the list easier (thus saving someone a lot of time) is ok, but writing a program to estimate how long it will take until you get to a certain amount of rep is definitely over a line.

I still want to do it though I probably won't. But now I'm thinking of how many different ways you can come up with an estimate: based on how quickly you got the last 15 reps (what you can see on your profile), based on your rep/total time since registration (aka, your average over all the time you've been here), and looking at rep/post count/posts per day.

And now I want to sort everyone by their rate of rep gaining just to get some solid data on who and what gets the most rep the fastest. I fear that knowledge might promote attempts to gain rep for "the wrong reasons", though.
